revised_title: Inverse Scattering for Geophysical Problems: Velocity-Inversion and Acoustics
tldr: The authors explore inverse scattering problems in geophysics, focusing on velocity-inversion problems in acoustics. They develop analytical methods to recover the speed of sound in an unknown region using measurements from a time-harmonic source and known solutions on a plane interface between two different acoustic media. The study has potential applications in various geophysical situations, such as detecting metallic ore deposits or pipeline locations.
